str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of hieros; a sacred place, i.e. The entire precincts of the Temple.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To sell, exchange, barter. Probably ultimately from pelomai; to barter, i.e. To sell.
An ox, cow, bull. Probably from the base of bosko; an ox, i.e. An animal of that species.
A sheep. Probably neuter of a presumed derivative of probaino; something that walks forward, i.e., a sheep.
A dove, pigeon. Of uncertain derivation; a pigeon.
From a derivative of kerma; a handler of coins, i.e. Money-broker.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
